matrix-project.description:
builds and simulates many different configurations, automatic nightruns on master in case of problems: please contact fmoyen@fr.ibm.com or alexandre.castellane@fr.ibm.com => 2019.1 was default moved to 2019.2 AC june 26th 2020
KNOWN FAILURES : - hdl did not have a hw_test available, now they seems ok in IMG test but not in simulation - memcopy is being modified to deal with HBM - HBM cannot be simulated with xsim yet
Removed hdl_example.NORAM and hdl_example.DDR test considered as useless
!!! hbm tests are failing (collection of param for sim to update defconfig are not ok)
tymp removed : hdl_example hdl_single_engine hls_helloworld_512 hls_helloworld_1024 hls_memcopy_1024 hls_hbm_memcopy_1024 hls_image_filter hls_decimal_mult hls_hbm_memcopy_1024

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Choose the branch for https://github.com/OpenCAPI/oc-accel you want to test.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: OCSE_BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Choose the branch for https://github.com/OpenCAPI/ocse you want to test. (OpenCapi Simulation Engine)

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: VIVADO_CHOICE
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Choose the Vivado version to use

matrix-project.combinationFilter: ( ( (ACT=~"hls" && HLS=="true")||(ACT=~"hdl" && HDL=="true" ) ) && ( (CRD=~"AD9V3" && AD9V3=="true" && !(ACT=~"hls_hbm_memcopy_1024")) || (CRD=~"BW250SOC" && BW250SOC=="true" && !(ACT=~"hls_hbm_memcopy_1024")) || ( CRD=~"AD9H" && (AD9H3=="true"|| AD9H7=="true") && !(ACT=~"hls_memcopy_1024") ) ) ) || (ACT=="test" && CRD=="AD9V3")

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash set +x # reduce Jenkins output
echo "Hostname: `hostname`"; echo "ID: `id`" echo "Working dir is : $PWD"
echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "`date` BUILD START" echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "EXECUTING FIRST SHELL FROM OpenCAPI SIM JENKINS - V1.1 - 2019 march 06 - ..." echo "****************************************************************************************"
#============================================================================================== # Variables
> export_props.properties NAME=$(echo $GIT_BRANCH| cut -d'/' -f 2 |tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]') # remove origin/ from branch and translate to lowercase PREFIX=$(echo $NAME| cut -d'_' -f 1) # chars up to first '_' identify need for test ACTION_TYPE=$(echo $ACT| cut -d'_' -f 1) echo "SIM=$SIM" >>export_props.properties # chars up to first '_' identify Simulator VIV=$VIVADO_CHOICE; echo "VIV=$VIV" >>export_props.properties # chars behind first '_' identify Vivado version
echo "Build with Card=$CRD Action=$ACT Action_type=$ACTION_TYPE branch_selected=$BRANCH git_branch=$NAME prefix=$PREFIX"
#============================================================================================== # Do not run non-desired cases (action types, actions, cards)
BSKIP=0 if [ "$ACTION_TYPE" == "hdl" ] && [ "$HDL" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$ACTION_TYPE" == "hls" ] && [ "$HLS" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$CRD" == "AD9V3" ] && [ "$AD9V3" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$CRD" == "AD9H3" ] && [ "$AD9H3" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$CRD" == "AD9H7" ] && [ "$AD9H7" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$CRD" == "BW250SOC" ] && [ "$BW250SOC" == "false" ]; then BSKIP=1;fi if [ "$ACT" == "test" ]; then BSKIP=0;fi echo "action_types (hdl,hls)=$HDL,$HLS enabled_cards(AD9v3,AD9H3,AD9H7)=$AD9V3,$AD9H3,$AD9H7 $BW250SOC BSKIP=$BSKIP" echo
#============================================================================================== # Checking defconfig file linked to $ACT Action exists # defconfig files are here to replace the manual setup when user types "make snap_config" and # choses the card, the example action, the memory choices, etc ... he wants # defconfig contains predefined representative configurations ready for test # We generate them by manually coping the .snap_config files obtained after a "make snap_config"
case "$CRD:$ACT:$SIM" in *:test:* ) # What for ??? (test is used to check remotes machines and tokens are available) # gitnames=list of all remote branches gitnames=`git ls-remote git@github.ibm.com:OC-Enablement/oc-snap.git|grep "refs/heads/"|awk '{print $2}'`;RC=$? echo "RC=$RC" echo "gitnames= $gitnames" echo
for dir in "/var/jenkins/workspace/OC_Sim_Matrix"/*;do if [ -d "$dir" ];then branch="refs/heads/"`basename $dir` if [[ "$gitnames" =~ "$branch" ]];then echo "branch=$branch found in gitnames, keep dir=$dir" else echo "branch=$branch not found in gitnames, delete dir=\'$dir\'" rm -rf "$dir" # put in quotes to work for directories with blanks fi else echo "$dir is not a directory, continuing" fi done
#echo "mail informing castella test triggered" #mail -s "*OpenCAPI Jenkins SIMULATION started with : branch_selected=$BRANCH git_branch=$NAME prefix=$PREFIX" castella
date DSKIP=0;;
*:*:* ) if [ -f snap/defconfig/$CRD.$ACT.defconfig ];then DSKIP=0 else echo "$CRD.$ACT.defconfig does not exist" ls snap/defconfig/ DSKIP=1 fi;;
*:hls_memcopy_1024:*) if [[ $CRD != "AD9V3" && $CRD != "BW250SOC" ]]; then C="mcp"; ASKIP=1 fi;;
*:hls_hbm_memcopy_1024:*) if [[ $CRD != "AD9H3" && $CRD != "AD9H7" ]]; then C="nhbm"; ASKIP=1 fi;;
esac echo "defconfig SKIP=$DSKIP"
#============================================================================================== # Checking enough space is available
#AFSused=`fs lq /afs/bb/proj/fpga/framework/CI_ws/OC_SIM_matrix/|grep -v Used|awk '{print $4}'|sed 's/%//g'|sed 's/<//g'` diskused=`df -h /var/jenkins/workspace/OC_Sim_Matrix|grep -v Used|awk '{print $5}'|sed 's/%//g'|sed 's/<//g'` SSKIP=0;msg="diskused =${diskused}%" if (( diskused > 90 ));then msg="ERROR: $msg, stopping additional builds";SSKIP=1 #echo "mail sent to castella : ERROR OpenCAPI AFS space" #mail -s "ERROR: OpenCAPI AFS space SIMULATION is used up to ${diskused}%, stopping additional builds" castella #mail -s "ERROR: AFS space SIMULATION is used up to ${AFSused}%, stopping additional builds" mesnet
elif (( diskused > 70 ));then msg="WARNING: $msg" #echo "mail sent to castella : WARNING OpenCAPI AFS space" #mail -s "WARNING: OpenCAPI AFS space IMAGETEST is used up to ${diskused}%" castella #mail -s "WARNING: AFS space IMAGETEST is used up to ${AFSused}%" mesnet fi echo "$msg"
#============================================================================================== # Any reason to abort ? If yes SKIP=1 used in next conditional step and passed to next script
if (( ASKIP+DSKIP+BSKIP+SSKIP > 0 ));then SKIP=1;else SKIP=0;fi pwd echo "SKIP=$SKIP" >>export_props.properties echo "properties passed to next shell:" cat export_props.properties echo "***********************************************************"

#!/bin/bash set +x # reduce Jenkins output
echo "Hostname: `hostname`"; echo "ID: `id`"
ulimit -S -c 128000 echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" echo "EXECUTING SECOND SHELL FROM OpenCAPI SIM JENKINS - V1.1 - 2019 march 21 - ..." echo "****************************************************************************************"
#============================================================================================== # Variables
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin # python3 needs this path setup export USERHOME=$PWD export SNAP_ROOT=$USERHOME/snap
#============================================================================================== # LSF Variables setup
ulimit -c unlimited # reduce core dumps from what .profile says (kB) #echo;echo "********************************************************************************" #echo "J: LSF SETUP ..."
# older setup up to RH6 #export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SERVERDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/etc #export LSF_LIBDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib #export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/lib #export LSF_BINDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux2.6-glibc2.3-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SUBMITTER_OSTYPE=Linux #export LSF_ENVDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/conf #LSF='-P zsort -M 2 -C 2000 -I -n 4 -R type=X86_64 -R span[hosts=1]' # Project, GB_mem, KB_core, #_processors, type of processor
# new setup for RH7 #export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SERVERDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/etc #export LSF_LIBDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/lib #export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/lib #export LSF_BINDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/10.1/linux3.10-glibc2.17-x86_64/bin #export LSF_SUBMITTER_OSTYPE=Linux #export LSF_ENVDIR=/home/lsfbb/prod/conf #LSF='-P zsort -M 2 -C 2000 -I -n 4 -R type=X86_64 -R osver=rh7 -R span[hosts=1]' # Project, GB_mem, KB_core, #_processors, type of processor
#============================================================================================== # OpenCAPI Simulation Engine (ocse) setup
echo;echo "*******************************************************************************" echo "Current directory is : $PWD" echo "*****" ls -al echo "deleting ocse (OpenCAPI Simulation Engine) directory" rm -rf ocse
# When Lance Thomson makes a mod in his OCSE, we might use a specific branch for test # 2019 Nov 04 he merged the issue_2 into master (removing the debug messages)
echo "J: Get OpenCAPI Simulation Environment (ocse) branch=$OCSE_BRANCH for card=$CRD..." git clone -b $OCSE_BRANCH https://github.com/OpenCAPI/ocse ocse;echo "git clone OCSE RC=$?"
export OCSE_INSTALL_DIR=${USERHOME}/ocse # ca ne sert Ã rien on dirait !!
cd ${SNAP_ROOT} echo "exporting ocse directory as : ${USERHOME}/ocse into snap_env" echo "export OCSE_ROOT=${USERHOME}/ocse" >snap_env.sh #echo "#setup: XILINX_LOCAL_USER_DATA=${XILINX_LOCAL_USER_DATA}, overwrite=no to prevent write access error in XilincTclStore (tclapp:load_apps)" >>snap_env.sh echo "export XILINX_LOCAL_USER_DATA=no" >> snap_env.sh
echo echo "snap_env.sh" echo "-----------" cat snap_env.sh
#============================================================================================== # Check Vivado version ($VIV) is supported
echo;echo "****************************************************************************************" case $VIV in # test multiple Vivado versions in one build
2019.1) echo "J: Vivado Version is OK: $VIV" ;; 2019.2) echo "J: Vivado Version is OK: $VIV" ;;
*) echo "J: unsupported Vivado version $VIV";exit 1;; esac
#============================================================================================== # Vivado setup # SIM=xsim => no need for specific licensing configuration # here we setup the parameters for Cadence simulators # for the moment I run only xsim (from Xilinx, but Bruno would like to setup irun too) # xcelium ??? we cannot support all simulators anyway.
echo "J: Vivado SETUP $VIV ..." export XILINX_ROOT=/opt/Xilinx export XILINXD_LICENSE_FILE=2100@pokwinlic1.pok.ibm.com source $XILINX_ROOT/Vivado/${VIV}/settings64.sh
case $SIM:$VIV in
xcelium:2018.2 ) echo "J: Cadence SETUP $IES_VERSION for Vivado 2018.2" export PATH=$CDS_INST_DIR/tools/bin:$PATH # export CDS_LIC_FILE=5280@auslnxlic01.austin.ibm.com export CDS_LIC_FILE=5280@cdsserv1.pok.ibm.com:5280@cdsserv2.pok.ibm.com export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$CDS_INST_DIR/tools/lib/64bit:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH if [ -f "$IES_LIBS/cds.lib" ] then echo "J: IES_LIBS found in $IES_LIBS" else echo "J: WARNING: cannot find IES_LIBS=$IES_LIBS, Cadence compilation won't work";exit 1 fi ;;
irun:*|IRUN:*|xcelium:* ) echo "Cadence SETUP $IES_VERSION for Vivado 2018.1" export PATH=$CDS_INST_DIR/tools/bin:$PATH export CDS_LIC_FILE=5280@hdlic10.boeblingen.de.ibm.com:5280@hdlic11.boeblingen.de.ibm.com export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$CDS_INST_DIR/tools/lib/64bit:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH # echo "export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$CDS_INST_DIR/tools/lib/64bit:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH" >> snap_env.sh if [ -f "$IES_LIBS/cds.lib" ] then echo "IES_LIBS found in $IES_LIBS" else echo "J: WARNING: cannot find IES_LIBS=$IES_LIBS, Cadence compilation won't work";exit 1 fi ;; esac
#============================================================================================== # Make with defconfig file or just exiting if ACT=test
echo;echo "********************************************************************************" echo "J: Build defconfig File (make $CRD.action.defconfig) ..."
case $ACT in # select config & compile action
'test') echo "J: ACT=test ==> just exit 0";exit 0;; # just exit
*DENALI*) act2=${ACT%.DENALI} echo "build action for ACT=$ACT act2=$act2" make $CRD.$act2.defconfig ;;
*) echo "J: Current directory:$PWD" echo "defconfig directory content:" echo "----------------------------" ls defconfig/
# before rh7 issue we did : make $CRD.$ACT.defconfig # since we need RH7 we use LSF: #bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_${SIM}_defconfig" "hostname;lsb_release -a"|| exit 1 echo;echo "J: making $CRD.$ACT.defconfig" make $CRD.$ACT.defconfig|| exit 1 ;; esac
case $ACT in # manually forcing BRAM usage to emulate the HBM in simulation # We will see HBM but modeling will be BRAM *hbm*) # when simulating an HBM Chip, we replace the HBM by a DDR to allow simulation to occur # We manually set the following parameters which will change the HBM configuration at SOFTWARE level echo "ENABLE_BRAM=y" >> .snap_config echo "BRAM_USED=\"TRUE\"" >> .snap_config echo "ENABLE_DDRI=y" >> .snap_config echo "DDRI_USED=\"TRUE\"" >> .snap_config make -s oldconfig
# We manually set the following parameters which will change the HBM configuration at HDL level # We assume that end lines are overwriting previous defaults ones echo "SNAP_CFLAGS += \"-DCONFIG_ENABLE_BRAM=y\"" >> .snap_config.cflags echo "SNAP_CFLAGS += \"-DCONFIG_BRAM_USED=TRUE\"" >> .snap_config.cflags echo "SNAP_CFLAGS += \"-DCONFIG_ENABLE_DDRI=y\"" >> .snap_config.cflags echo "SNAP_CFLAGS += \"-DCONFIG_DDRI_USED=TRUE\"" >> .snap_config.cflags ;;
# AC 2020/11/24 # manually forcing Ethernet loopback usage when simulating *udp*) # We manually set the following parameters which will change the ETH configuration at SOFTWARE level echo "ENABLE_ETH_LOOP_BACK=y" >> .snap_config make -s oldconfig
# We manually set the following parameters which will change the HBM configuration at HDL level # We assume that end lines are overwriting previous defaults ones echo "SNAP_CFLAGS += \"-DCONFIG_ENABLE_ETH_LOOP_BACK=y\"" >> .snap_config.cflags ;;
esac
#============================================================================================== # Build Simulation Model (make model)
echo;echo "********************************************************************************" echo "J: Build Simulation Model (make model)..."
case $SIM:$ACT in 'xsim':*|'XSIM':* ) echo "export SIMULATOR=xsim" >> .snap_config.sh sed -i "s/^SIM_/# SIM_/" .snap_config echo "SIM_XSIM=y" >> .snap_config;; # overwrite simulator 'irun':*DENALI|'IRUN':*DENALI ) echo "ENABLE_DENALI=y" >> .snap_config;make -s oldconfig echo "export SIMULATOR=irun" >> .snap_config.sh sed -i "s/^SIM_/# SIM_/" .snap_config echo "SIM_IRUN=y" >> .snap_config;; # overwrite simulator 'irun':*|'IRUN':* ) echo "export SIMULATOR=irun" >> .snap_config.sh sed -i "s/^SIM_/# SIM_/" .snap_config echo "SIM_IRUN=y" >> .snap_config;; # overwrite simulator xcelium:*DENALI) echo "ENABLE_DENALI=y" >> .snap_config;make -s oldconfig echo "export SIMULATOR=xcelium" >> .snap_config.sh sed -i "s/^SIM_/# SIM_/" .snap_config echo "SIM_XCELIUM=y" >> .snap_config;; # overwrite simulator xcelium:*) echo "export SIMULATOR=xcelium" >> .snap_config.sh sed -i "s/^SIM_/# SIM_/" .snap_config echo "SIM_XCELIUM=y" >> .snap_config;; # overwrite simulator questa:*) echo "export SIMULATOR=questa" >> .snap_config.sh sed -i "s/^SIM_/# SIM_/" .snap_config echo "SIM_QUESTA=y" >> .snap_config;; # overwrite simulator modelsim:*) echo "export SIMULATOR=modelsim" >> .snap_config.sh sed -i "s/^SIM_/# SIM_/" .snap_config echo "SIM_MODELSIM=y" >> .snap_config;; # overwrite simulator *) echo "J: WARNING: unknown simulator=$SIM, continuing with default";; esac
echo ".snap_config.sh" echo "---------------" cat .snap_config.sh echo
echo ".snap_config" echo "------------" cat .snap_config echo
# execute with LSF, SNAP_ROOT must reside in AFS #echo "J: PATH=$PATH" #which irun
#Added 2019 03 06 # removed Nov 4th since it should be done automatically by oc-accel #git submodule init #git submodule update #AC XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXxx make model|| exit 1
#bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_${SIM}_model" "hostname;lsb_release -a;make model"|| exit 1
#============================================================================================== # Run simulation
echo;echo "********************************************************************************" echo "J: Run $SIM Simulation (formerly using LSF, but now on local executors) ..." echo "J: cd ${SNAP_ROOT}/hardware/sim" cd ${SNAP_ROOT}/hardware/sim
##### enable SW trace # export SNAP_TRACE=0xf ##### execute locally # ./run_sim -list testlist.sh -noaet
##### execute on AFS with LSF, report error as unstable build case $SIM in # run in the proper ${ACT} directory /tests/hw_test.sh 'xsim'|'XSIM' ) #bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_${SIM}" "${SNAP_ROOT}/hardware/sim/run_sim -list ../../actions/${ACT}/tests/hw_test.sh -noaet"||exit 100 echo "J: launching : ./run_sim -list testlist_simple.sh -noaet||exit 100" ./run_sim -list testlist_simple.sh -noaet||exit 100 ;;
# older way to run with capi snap # 'xsim'|'XSIM' ) bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_${SIM}" "./run_sim -list testlist.sh -noaet"||exit 100;; # 'irun'|'IRUN' ) bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_${SIM}" "./run_sim -irun -list testlist.sh -noaet"||exit 100;; # *) bsub $LSF -J "${CRD}_${ACT}_${SIM}" "./run_sim -list testlist.sh -noaet"||exit 100;;
esac
